channel.title: Causality on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Causality on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Non-parametric Direct Learning Approach to Heterogeneous Treatment Effect Estimation under Unmeasured Confounding
item.description: Estimating heterogeneous treatment effects (CATE) under unmeasured confounding is revolutionized by a novel non-parametric direct learning approach using instrumental variables, offering efficient and…

item.title: Automated Efficient Estimation using Monte Carlo Efficient Influence Functions
item.description: MC-EIF automates efficient statistical estimation for high-dimensional models, integrating seamlessly with existing differentiable probabilistic programming systems and achieving optimal convergence r…

item.title: Causal Discovery from Event Sequences by Local Cause-Effect Attribution
item.description: CASCADE algorithm unveils hidden causal structures in event sequences by minimizing description length, surpassing existing Granger causality-based methods.

item.title: Causal vs. Anticausal merging of predictors
item.description: Causal assumptions drastically alter predictor merging, with CMAXENT revealing logistic regression for causal and LDA for anticausal directions.

item.title: ChronoEpilogi: Scalable Time Series Selection with Multiple Solutions
item.description: ChronoEpilogi efficiently finds all minimal sets of time-series variables optimally predicting a target, improving forecasting while providing crucial insights for knowledge discovery and causal model…

item.title: Conditional Generative Models are Sufficient to Sample from Any Causal Effect Estimand
item.description: ID-GEN: Sample high-dimensional interventional distributions using any conditional generative model!

item.title: Conditional Outcome Equivalence: A Quantile Alternative to CATE
item.description: Researchers introduce the Conditional Quantile Comparator (CQC) for analyzing heterogeneous treatment effects, offering an improved approach by combining the strengths of CATE and CQTE while overcomin…

item.title: Do Finetti: On Causal Effects for Exchangeable Data
item.description: Causal inference revolutionized: New framework estimates causal effects from exchangeable data, enabling simultaneous causal discovery and effect estimation via the Do-Finetti algorithm.

item.title: Estimating Heterogeneous Treatment Effects by Combining Weak Instruments and Observational Data
item.description: This study develops a novel two-stage framework for accurately predicting conditional average treatment effects using both observational data and weak instrumental variables, overcoming limitations of…

item.title: Exogenous Matching: Learning Good Proposals for Tractable Counterfactual Estimation
item.description: Exogenous Matching learns optimal proposals for efficient counterfactual estimation by transforming variance minimization into conditional distribution learning, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Hybrid Top-Down Global Causal Discovery with Local Search for Linear and Nonlinear Additive Noise Models
item.description: Hybrid causal discovery algorithm efficiently learns unique causal graphs from observational data by leveraging local substructures and topological sorting, outperforming existing methods in accuracy …

item.title: Identification and Estimation of the Bi-Directional MR with Some Invalid Instruments
item.description: PReBiM algorithm accurately estimates bi-directional causal effects from observational data, even with invalid instruments, using a novel cluster fusion approach.

item.title: Identifying Causal Effects Under Functional Dependencies
item.description: Unlocking identifiability of causal effects: This paper leverages functional dependencies in causal graphs to improve identifiability, leading to fewer needed variables in observational data.

item.title: Linear Causal Representation Learning from Unknown Multi-node Interventions
item.description: Unlocking Causal Structures: New algorithms identify latent causal relationships from interventions, even when multiple variables are affected simultaneously.

item.title: Marginal Causal Flows for Validation and Inference
item.description: Frugal Flows: Generate realistic causal benchmarks with exact marginal causal effects, enabling robust causal method validation.

item.title: On the Complexity of Identification in Linear Structural Causal Models
item.description: New polynomial-space algorithm for causal parameter identification in linear models vastly improves upon existing methods, showing that this crucial task is computationally hard.

item.title: On the Identifiability of Poisson Branching Structural Causal Model Using Probability Generating Function
item.description: Researchers developed a novel, efficient causal discovery method using Probability Generating Functions to identify causal structures within Poisson Branching Structural Causal Models, overcoming limi…

item.title: Partial Structure Discovery is Sufficient for No-regret Learning in Causal Bandits
item.description: Learning optimal interventions in causal bandits with unknown causal graphs is now efficient; this paper identifies the minimal causal knowledge needed and offers a two-stage algorithm with sublinear …
